decks.notes: This deck focuses on efficiently executing a powerful combo without relying on lands. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to generate a win condition quickly. Cards like Force of Negation and Jwari Disruption help protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. With a mix of counter spells, card draw, and removal, the deck aims to control the game while setting up for a big combo finish. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful burst of damage or disruption before they can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on generating fast mana through rituals and medallions, while digging through the deck with Impulse and Glimpse to find the combo pieces needed for a powerful storm turn. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Artist's talent provide additional card advantage and combo potential. The deck aims to set up a big Past in Flames turn to recur rituals and spells in the graveyard, finishing off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. It is an explosive combo deck that can go off quickly and punish opponents who are unprepared.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo, using cards like Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Summoner's Pact to search for and put key pieces into play. The goal is to use these cards to ramp up to powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand, while also generating additional value through cards like Consign to Memory and Disciple of Freyalise. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to ensure the combo can be executed without interruption.

This deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly accelerate mana production, allowing for the efficient casting of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Herigast, Erupting Nullkite provide additional threats and utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early on and overpower opponents with its Eldrazi threats in the mid to late game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with efficient creatures and burn spells. It utilizes cards like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to put pressure on the opponent early. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional power and toughness to the creatures. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for direct damage to finish off opponents. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls. Utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks or finish off opponents. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional support and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory helps to control the board and protect our creatures. Showdown of the Skalds adds extra power to our board presence, while Ranger-Captain of Eos provides utility and protects key cards.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones from the graveyard. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to assemble its combo quickly, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and overwhelm them with powerful creatures and control elements.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creature cards, and then utilizing various spells like Persist and Unearth to reanimate them onto the battlefield for a quick win. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The spell Pierce helps protect the combo pieces, while Faithless Looting and Thought Scour provide card selection and graveyard filling. This deck is all about fast-paced reanimation and aggressive plays.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate large amounts of mana through rituals and spells, while also cycling through the deck with cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to find combo pieces. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Dragon's Rage Channeler provide additional card advantage and ways to deal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to cast a large Grapeshot or generate enough mana to continuously loop spells with Past in Flames for a strong finish, utilizing Valakut Awakening and Wish for additional flexibility and recursion.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls leading the charge. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach and removal options. The deck aims to close out the game swiftly using the synergy between creatures and burn spells, supported by utility cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison. The mana base is optimized for consistent early aggression and the deck is designed to put pressure on the opponent from the very beginning.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a lot of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and creatures such as Ugin, Tezzeret, and Karn. The deck aims to control the board with cards like All Is Dust and Engineered Explosives, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void. The win condition of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with threats like Sire of Seven Deaths and Devourer of Destiny, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and massive creature presence.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. It also utilizes powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board and protect its creatures. The deck can generate additional value with cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer, while also maintaining pressure with Goblin Bombardment. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional ways to close out games efficiently, making this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and setting up for a powerful combo using Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor and various land tutors, the deck aims to create a board state where it can either deal a massive amount of damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle or search for key lands like Vesuva and Lotus Field to further enhance its combo potential. With strong land synergy and the ability to quickly assemble its win conditions, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace its opponents in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent by using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, Counterspell, and Force of Negation. It also utilizes creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares for additional threats. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Cling to Dust provide card advantage and graveyard recursion, while Stern Scolding and Sink into Stupor help to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Finally, the deck includes land cards for mana fixing and consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize graveyard recursion and powerful creatures to create a combo-based reanimation strategy. By filling up the graveyard with cards like Thought Scour and Faithless Looting, the deck aims to bring back big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones with cards like Persist and Unearth. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board while setting up the combo. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful reanimated creatures while maintaining control and tempo.

This deck revolves around quickly deploying artifacts onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of threats. By utilizing efficient mana acceleration and strong card draw, the goal is to play powerful artifact creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary alongside equipment such as Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to close out games swiftly. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact synergy and tutor options, while Metallic Rebuke serves as a versatile counterspell to protect the game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent before they can establish their own board presence.
